New_York.Doyers Street: Doyers Street is a 200-foot-long (61 m) street in the heart of Chinatown in the New York City borough of Manhattan. It is one block in length and has a sharp bend in the middle. The street runs south and then southeast from Pell Street to the intersection of Bowery, Chatham Square, and Division Street. The street contains several restaurants, barber shops, and hair stylists, as well as the Chinatown branch of the United States Postal Service. The Nom Wah Tea Parlor opened at 13 Doyers Street in 1927, and is still in operation; other longstanding business include Ting's Gift Shop at 18 Doyers.
